answer_found_by_llm: No embedded manifest found in challenge.exe
No obfuscation technique is detected in challenge.exe; the strings appear in plain form.
No API is used for allocating memory to write shellcode.
No memory protection technique is used by allocated memory.
No assembly instruction used to transfer execution flow to the shellcode was found.
No, there is no evidence that the malware obfuscates strings after calling RegisterClassExA.
Yes, the malware employs process hollowing by creating a process in a suspended state (using CreateProcessA with CREATE_SUSPENDED), which is a classic process injection technique.
No api is used to write the payload into the target process.
